DataElement.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Genital Involvement NIH Consensus Response Criteria for cGVHD Severity Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Information related to the NIH Consensus Response Criteria for cGVHD severity of genital involvement.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Genital Involvement
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases. The onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation._The group of organs and glands involved with having a child. In women, these are the uterus (womb), the fallopian tubes, the ovaries, and the vagina (birth canal). The reproductive system in men includes the testes, the prostate, and the penis._To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Genital
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases. The onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.:The group of organs and glands involved with having a child. In women, these are the uterus (womb), the fallopian tubes, the ovaries, and the vagina (birth canal). The reproductive system in men includes the testes, the prostate, and the penis.

Concepts.definition: A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases. The onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.

The group of organs and glands involved with having a child. In women, these are the uterus (womb), the fallopian tubes, the ovaries, and the vagina (birth canal). The reproductive system in men includes the testes, the prostate, and the penis.

Property.preferredDefinition: To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

Concepts.definition: To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Genital NIH Consensus Response Criteria for cGVHD Severity Score
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The group of organs and glands involved with having a child. In women, these are the uterus (womb), the fallopian tubes, the ovaries, and the vagina (birth canal). The reproductive system in men includes the testes, the prostate, and the penis._A tool used to assess response to therapy for chronic Graft versus Host Disease (cGVHD) based on clinical trial findings and recommended by the NIH Chronic Graft-versus-Host Disease Consensus Response Criteria Working Group. The criteria were established in 2005 (Biol Blood Marrow Transplant, 12 (2006), pp. 252-266) and revised in 2014 (Biol Blood Marrow Transplant, 21 (2015), pp. 984-999)._Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: The group of organs and glands involved with having a child. In women, these are the uterus (womb), the fallopian tubes, the ovaries, and the vagina (birth canal). The reproductive system in men includes the testes, the prostate, and the penis.

Concepts.longName: NIH Consensus Response Criteria for Chronic GVHD
Concepts.definition: A tool used to assess response to therapy for chronic Graft versus Host Disease (cGVHD) based on clinical trial findings and recommended by the NIH Chronic Graft-versus-Host Disease Consensus Response Criteria Working Group. The criteria were established in 2005 (Biol Blood Marrow Transplant, 12 (2006), pp. 252-266) and revised in 2014 (Biol Blood Marrow Transplant, 21 (2015), pp. 984-999).
Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
